title: table
content: </> type table = {} Used to represent a table instead of typing {} since its more visual and I'm used to it

title: Proxy
content: </> Proxy.Proxy: table Table as a proxy. All keys added to the Proxy object are added to this table

title: Indexed
content: </> Proxy.Indexed: Signal Signal fired when a proxy's key is indexed local Value = if Proxy.Something then true else nil -- Indexed is fired, we got Something value

title: Changed
content: </> Proxy.Changed: Signal Signal fired when a new key is added to the proxy or when a key's value changes

title: InheritProxies
content: </> Proxy.InheritProxies: boolean Defines if tables added to the proxy should be converted to a proxy that inherits its parent proxy properties

title: new
content: </> Proxy.new( Origin?: table,-- Optional table to convert and use as the proxy InheritProxies?: boolean,-- Should other tables added to the proxy become a proxy with same properties? CustomProperties?: table-- Custom properties that can be added on creation of the proxy and its children (equivalent of using rawset) ) → Proxy Creates a new Proxy class.

title: Destroy
content: </> Proxy:Destroy() → nil Destroys the proxy and disconnects all of its connections.
